alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:56AM EDT until June 16 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE...WEST CENTRAL SULLIVAN AND NORTHEASTERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 355 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hankins, or 18 miles northeast of Honesdale, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Damascus, Callicoon, Cochecton, Fremont, Equinunk, Stalker, Hortonville, Hankins, Abrahamsville and North Branch. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
